channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Free loading bay cross the street not used causing excessive noise level daily, 19th June
item.description:
Loading bay in Royal Parade even though free not used causing excessive noise level as van refrigerator compressor running constantly for hours every day 10 feet from my sofa in Brigade Street. Van delivering to restaurant Cote Brasserie on the street corner. Van could park cross the street causing significantly lover noise level. Driver refused cooperation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Royal Parade, Blackheath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins overflowing and bin area untidy - attracting rats, 19th June
item.description:
The covered bin store and surrounding area on the Sylvester House estate north-west corner (straight ahead through blue gates on Wilton Way beside flats 61-80) contains overflowing bins; pests including rats and foxes are being attracted to the area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sylvester Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This bush is overgrowing the path and you have limited space to walk., 19th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maud Cashmore Way, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal electric scooter operating at extensive speeds, 19th June
item.description:
It has been observed the repeated use of what appears to be an illegal electric scooter within the premises by one of the residents of 56 Lighterman Court. The scooter is often operated at extensive speeds and has been seen traveling on public roads and pedestrian pavements. This behaviour presents a significant safety hazard and is a breach of traffic laws and property regulations. We urge appropriate action be taken to address this issue promptly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, High Street, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Buses at Bus stand Royal Parade choose to rev diesel engine repeatedly, 19th June
item.description:
Despite a Transport for London sign stating: Notice to drivers Engines must be switched off whilst on stand drivers constantly rev their engines. This happens all through the day. I live cross the street and have a too high noise level from this problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Royal Parade, Blackheath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotten wood posts laving gaps in car park boundary, 19th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eynsford Close, Crofton, London

item.title: Flytipping, 19th June
item.description:
These items (matress and other rubbish) have been here for several weeks. They are located in the alleyway behind the shops at Newmarket Green. Please can they be removed. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 244, Kingsground, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sweeper van doesn't clean and weeds need removing, 19th June
item.description:
Hi, a few times now the road sweeper van has driven into our street and caused more dirt in the street by dropping rubble and stones in the road that weren't there before and then kicking up dirt that goes all over our cars, there is no advantage to what they do. (the photo does not do it justice, as the big stones were laid there a few weeks ago.) Are there other types of methods than this one vehicle that does a terrible job? Also, there have been large weeds growing on the pavement now for a while, can that be arranged to be cleared? or please direct me to where I need to raise this. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayward Close, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped waste continued from Boro Bistro, 19th June
item.description:
We have seen flytipping from here before. We have raised this internally. There were documents that revealed the rubbish was from there. Today I saw food receipts that were from items on the Boro Bistro menu (in photos). This is the third time in the last two weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montague Close, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
